title: Media Reporting Analyst
full description:
The role: Media Reporting Analyst
We are looking for a Reporting Analyst to join our Marketing Effectiveness team based in our Dublin office.
Are you are next star player?
We are building a new Marketing Effectiveness team, and we’re looking for individuals with big ideas and the ability to think creatively and outside of the box. You will become part of a company that gives you everything you need to create winning moments to push your own boundaries and build the best experience for our millions of players around the world.
Why we need you:
We are seeking a highly analytical and data-centric Reporting Analyst to join the team. We would like to hear from individuals who are passionate about data, visualising data and turning data into business value. Enjoy using data to tell a story.
The role will involve conducting in-depth reporting and analysis to identify meaningful insights and making recommendations that will influence the direction of the business.
You will be responsible for:
Compiling and populating Performance marketing set of reports and distributing to the wider business.
Post campaign analysis across all campaigns and verticals – collaborating closely with channel owners and responsibility of the analysis and performance review of each campaign.
Working with the relevant channels to prioritise business and information needs and evaluate brand and top of funnel campaigns.
Leveraging data and working with the Digital teams to understand tracking and acquisition performance across all acquisition channels.
Identify and investigate trends, patterns, anomalies, spikes and other occurrences in data sets that will help drive intelligent planning and decisions.
Collaborating with the wider team and business partners to building innovative reporting and insight solutions using existing and external tools. Identifying any gaps in coordination with the Marketing Effectiveness roadmap
Advise internal team with regards to patterns and relationships in the data. Working with the team to recommend campaign direction
Maintaining excellent communication with all channel leads and ensure they are well-informed regarding key performance indicator trends
Work with cross-functional teams to build reports and interactive experiences for data delivery and easily understood presentation to executives.
Who we’re looking for:
An individual with proven experience in delivering reports and presentations through visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI, Powerpoint, Tableau etc.
SQL coding ability and proven experience in ETL process and procedures
Someone who is skilled in problem solving and has excellent analytical skills and ability to provide impactful insights from data.
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.

Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.
Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

title: EMEA Analytics Solutions Analyst
full description:
Position Overview:

As part of the EMEA Analytics & Insights Capabilities Team you will enable our partners to make decision with connected data/Advanced Analytics solutions and establish metrics that drive business outcomes. The Analytics Solutions Analyst will help translate strategic business questions into scalable metrics and drive analysis based on findings & optimization. You will partner with our Analytics and Insights teams to pilot and prototype Advanced Analytic solutions. You will use your technical skills, modeling abilities, and digging into the data and delivering key insights that can help enable connected data and advance our data maturity. A team-player attitude is crucial, we value collaboration, willingness to learn, curiosity, purpose, and diversity as part of our culture.
Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for leveraging our data to create analytics that can support current and future needs, driving analytical maturity, new capabilities, partnering with data architecture, governance, solutions and Platform Service center Data and IT teams.
Design systems and processes to document data & Analytical Solutions across business functions
Adding intelligence with AI/ML where it matters to create new efficiencies and new value
Problem-solve with product and business teams, advise executive team how to leverage Advanced Analytics across the company.
Foster the cross-system connectivity to each other within the function, with other business functions and any other Enterprise functions
Align with peer Analytics Solutions Leads to build shareable/reusable solutions and eliminate silos
Identify common data & Advanced Analytics needs vs exclusive needs
Study current data systems & Advanced Analytics solutions in place and problems need to be addressed
Cross share functional learnings with the peer Analytics Solutions Leads and with Capabilities Team to drive deployment of global solutions and standards
Education Requirements:
Master’s or PhD in Quantitative field, (ML/AI , Computer Sc./Advanced Analytics, Econometrics).
Advanced Programming skills VB, Python, R, SQL, (GAMS and Java a plus)
Bayesian Statistics knowledge is a plus
Related Work Experience:
Minimum 3 years’ experience in similar role.
Experience using Agile delivery methodologies
Experience on MS DevOps and Azure Databricks.
Experience building Forecasting Tools
Experience building Geolocation Data Analytics Tools is a plus
Experience applying Dynamic Optimization methods is a plus
Experience in Big Data and Cloud solution implementation is a plus
Functional Skills:
Strong team player
Analytical & communication skills
Demonstrated track record of capability development that has led to improved business results
A passion to learn/develop and bring in emerging trends/technology that drive further insight value
The mindset of an entrepreneurial thinker and is a self-starter, displaying proactive thinking
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

title: Business Analyst
full description:
The Opportunity

We are going through a period of rapid growth and the finance team is recruiting and expanding their team to meet these demands and scale for future growth. As part of a large-scale transformation programme, we are looking for an experienced and highly motivated person to join eShopWorld as a Business Analyst.

The successful candidate will have a high understanding of Excel and VBA, with a vision to automate and structure large amounts of data through Excel, VBA, RPA or other technologies. The candidate will be responsible for structuring current reporting models to enhance, automate and create inter-relational data structures between tasks and departments. This position requires a close working relationship with key stakeholders to understand their specific data requirements and developing the necessary documentation to support the team across the development and support after implementation.

Key Responsibilities:

Transformation activities:

Ability to analyse and document in relevant detail business processes and user requirements.
Design reporting models and processes in Excel, and define required automations
Structure data flows and inter-relationships between processes and departments
Produce both process and data flow maps as required identifying timings, functional responsibilities etc.
Effectively translate stakeholders' problems or demands into solutions. Map and document the desired outcomes to show the `To be' processes against the processes which can be supported by a technical solution or package
Continually critically analyse development requirements in terms of solution design, dependency, and value / outcome
Effectively engage with stakeholders to ensure clarity of expectation and outcome to reduce iteration cycles or misinterpretation
Define resource allocation and priority of activities in collaboration with stakeholders
Assist stakeholders in reviewing functionality outcomes to ensure in line with original scoping and assisting where outcome is not in line with expectation (successful UAT of data related solutions)
Ensure full alignment between various internal and external teams to confirm and gain agreement to the desired outcomes
Ability to facilitate information gathering sessions to capture key Business Requirements
Ability to self-manage the business analysis activity through to completion

Technology based activities:

Identify best technology to use for each solution implementation
Identify improvements and enhancements by applying different technologies
Define required formulas or VBA solutions to simplify and automate data models
Define implementation process using RPA and/or Alteryx
Lead User Acceptance Testing as part of our go-live preparation
Maintain a high level of knowledge about all products, systems and procedures that relate to each of the implementations
Foster and lead a continuous improvement culture. Identify process improvements and process re-engineering, to help to improve business practices
Participate in architectural process reviews as part of project and strategic initiatives
Data Management Governance
Manage Ad hoc projects and tasks as assigned from time to time
Prioritize, schedule and complete development and testing required for multiple applications with overlapping schedules

 Essential Qualifications & Experience:

Highly analytical with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Minimum of 5 years' business analysis experience across a variety of functions or domains
Proven experience designing and architecting solutions in Excel, VBA, Power Pivot and Access/SQL
Knowledge of RPA (UiPath preferred), Alteryx, automation tools and other automation technologiesBachelor's degree in a Business/Technology/Engineering or related degree
Technical experience; for example with business intelligence platforms database knowledge (i.e.Looker, PowerBI)
Experience working in an Agile environment
Excellent facilitation & critical analysis skills
Strong communication & translation of requirements skills.
Process and Data mapping experience
You should want to work in a fast-paced eCommerce business
Ability to influence and manage multiple stakeholders
Excellent operational organisation skills
High level of initiative and desire to get things done
Willingness to introduce change and challenge existing processes and procedures
eCommerce and or logistics industry experience is highly desirable

What's on offer?

Career growth – tailored learning & development, tuition assistance and professional certification.
Health & Wellbeing – dental & health insurance, reduced corporate gym membership, paid sick leave.
Work Life Balance – 25 days annual leave, flexible working, sports & social club.
Family – paid maternity & paternity leave, life assurance, income disability cover.
Financial – competitive salary, pension, stock option scheme, bike to work, travel TaxSaver, relocation assistance.

About us

Founded in 2010, eShopWorld powers cross-border ecommerce for the world's best-known brands, creating safer, simpler, and faster shopping experiences for consumers all around the globe. ESW's powerful combination of technology and human ingenuity optimizes the entire shopper journey, from site development to demand generation to checkout, through shipping, customer service and returns.

With configurable end-to-end solutions in more than 200 markets worldwide, we fully manage payments, compliance, data security, fraud protection, taxes and tariffs, helping clients enter new markets in as few as 6 weeks, and dramatically improve results in current markets. Bringing together more than 400 experts across multiple disciplines, the ESW team delivers profitable growth for retailers and brands worldwide.

title: Product Analyst
full description:
As a Product Analyst, you are a member of a global team of data-driven influencers, setting the standard for how data and analytics is used at HubSpot, and inspiring our product teams to action.

Product and Engineering use multiple sources of data (user event data, NPS, and transactional data, etc) to discover what is going well for our customers, where we can improve, and what to build next. Product Analysts - individuals with high data literacy, intellectual curiosity, and communication skills - are at the center of these analyses and decisions; we work side-by-side with Product Management, User Experience, and Engineering leadership to inform and build better solutions for our customers.

In this role, while you operate with a high degree of autonomy, you benefit from the support of the Product Analytics community - sharing ideas, debating approaches, and receiving feedback to deliver more effective analyses and develop in your career.

General responsibilities:

Be a driving influencer on the use and application of analysis; deliver what's needed, and show what's possible
Partner with product stakeholders to understand your team's data and business needs; become an expert in translating these needs into specific analyses with actionable insights
Conduct quantitative analysis of user behavior to uncover issues or opportunities to improve the our customers' experience
Inform the design and analyze the outcomes of in-app tests and experiments
Collaborate across UX teams and business functions to infuse strategic, open ended research with quantitative insights
Communicate insights to your stakeholders with a data-driven point of view and plan for action

Examples of common projects:

Define (or redefine) leading indicators of success for your team. Serve as the expert for these metrics by understanding how data collection is instrumented in the product, how it flows through our ETL pipeline and is aggregated, and how metrics are defined in our analytics platform. Construct the core dashboards, visualizations and analyses to help stakeholders monitor product health and make better decisions
Perform ad hoc analyses into user behavior to inform specific, near-term experiment designs or product decisions or longer term product strategy
Partner with engineering and other internal operations teams to enable a high level of data integrity, consistency and clarity across cross multiple internal databases and reporting systems
Be a voice within your teams to educate, elevate and advocate for the continual value of leveraging analytics to inform decision making

From our Product and Engineering Blog: How HubSpot's product analysts transform the customer experience

Minimum Qualifications:

Academic or professional experience with a heavy quantitative, analytical focus
Practical experience in a business environment influencing decision making with data
Experience working with large datasets; particularly data mining, manipulation and exploration
Ability to write performant, complex SQL queries combining multiple sources of data
Comfortability with data analytics and statistical tools such as R or Python
Confidence using a variety of analytical and statistical techniques
Passionate about the role of data in helping solve complex questions
Excellent communication, storytelling, and collaboration skills

Above and Beyond Qualifications:

Knowledge of analytical development tools such as Amplitude, Looker, Git and dbt
Demonstrated passion for building products that delight customers and drive their success
Experience working at, or strong understanding of, a SaaS business.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply — we'd love to hear from you.


About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers' needs at any stage of growth. We're also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work through. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.


By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.

title: HCM Project Coordinator and Analyst
full description:
Our client, a tech multinational based in Dublin is looking for an individual with experience with Human Capital Management software, abscence mangagment tracking and time tracking for a 6 month contract. Within this role, you will be invovled in mapping out processes, gaining business requirements, wokring with project teams, and acting as a go to relationship manager between People Teams and Engineering Teams. This role is ideal for someone wtih a background in Human Resources, HCM software, and who have stepped in to an analytical role.
About the Team
The Global People Operations team strives to create and deliver a seamless and positive employee experience across the entire employee lifecycle. Leading with care and empathy, we develop efficient and simple people processes, systems, policies, and programs. We deliver data that is useful and accurate to create People-related strategies across the business. We manage people knowledge and provide expertise on how HR systems are connected.Our work also ensures the company remains protected and compliant. We strive to ensure employees feel heard and given the resources and support they need during the most important moments during their careers.
About the Role:
We are seeking a HCM Super user to assist in delivering technology solutions for HR programs. The ideal candidate will question common assumptions, rethink existing processes, and see every challenge as an opportunity for improvement. We're looking for an execution focused individual, who can look at the big picture from a user experience, technology and business standpoint but also connect this to the HR need. This role supports process and technology on a global scale.
Responsibilities
Identify and support transformative cross-functional initiatives to improve business outcomes for HR.
Support shared vision across the HR and business functions by partnering with key internal business stakeholders.
Acts as primary project contact to establish key stakeholder requirements and project objectives. Creating business requirements artifacts, including process designs, test scripts, and user stories.
Development of process documentation, stakeholder presentations and associated artifacts. Support project and process change management activities.
Maintain effective communication with project relevant stakeholders including creation of project plans and facilitate resolution of all issues to reach project goals.
Coordinate project activities across engineering and HR teams, define and track key project milestones and deliverables.
Analysis of data and metrics to inform product and process roadmaps.
Requirements:
4+ years experience implementing customer-facing technology solutions
4+ years experience driving small to medium technology initiatives
Experience creating business requirements artifacts, including process designs
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel and data analysis skills
Proven relationship and partnership building skills
Demonstrated experience leading global technical projects end-to-end with multiple stakeholders
Experience with Agile, Scrum, BABOK, SDLC or similar project management methodologies
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proven track record of effectively interacting with internal and external stakeholders
Demonstrated experience working in a fast-paced environment with stakeholders and users
Familiarity with Workday HCM including Absence and Time Tracking as either a super-user or configurator.
Familiarity with Salesforce Service Cloud
Experience leading change management initiatives
Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.
BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Senior IT Business Analyst
full description:
Senior IT Business Analyst- Head Office


GET TO KNOW US

We’re a retail world built on iconic firsts. Famed for the creativity that touches our brands, buildings and experiences. We’re always challenging ourselves to make every experience more special and unique for our customers and our people. We are committed to equality, diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are proud to have received bronze accreditation from the Irish Centre for Diversity as a result of successfully demonstrating the effective D&I policy’s that we have in place. Supported by strong family foundations that inspire us to create something that lasts, because we care about the tomorrow we’re carving out.

KNOW THE ROLE

Our IT department are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team.
Ability to design technical solution requirements and specification based on requests from the business.
Create tech specifications and requirements based on the business requirements to enable definition of user stories
Identify system dependencies and where/when changes are required in order to facilitate requirements - Perform system analysis on software programs, applications, and web services.
Responsible for initial feasibility assessment of projects/features which requires technical input
Close collaboration and assisting our Vendors with the delivery of the development tasks
Close collaboration with the delivery team to guide and advise on design and technical implementation of the solution in line with the client requirements
Ensure technical quality and good design principles are followed
Experience working in an agile multi-project environment, with multiple parallel projects developing new functionality
Understanding of high-level architecture, and how it integrates with other architectural components
Perform root cause analysis of any productions issues that may arise
Utilize systems and data to resolve business challenges in the most effective, innovative, and productive manner.
Serve as subject matter expert providing direction to less experienced staff.
Ensuring end-user proficiency with new systems, programs, and applications across departments.
Determining system efficiency and functionality by liaising with internal departments and end-users.
Efficiently integrating new systems, programs, and applications with business operations and services.
Ability to create and action regression/progression Test scripts.
Identify upstream and downstream impacts of a business or system change and work closely with teams across the organization to ensure process continuity and integrity.
 Manage and report on workload to your manager in a professional and clear way, to ensure steady delivery of tasks on time, while maintaining work life balance.
Take responsibility for documenting your output to a high professional standard, building time into your estimates to make sure this is always done.

KNOW WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

University degree or 5+ years of similar experience
Technical experience working across multiple inter-connected applications
Technical experience with XML & SQL.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, prioritization and decision-making skills.
Ability to address both technical and business requirements in solving problems.
Demonstrated experience in business process analysis, modelling, and re-engineering; background in process to system mapping, modelling, and implementation.
Experience creating technical documentation, activity and sequence diagram.
A detail-oriented and can-do approach
Additional Advantageous Knowledge
Experience in API and back end integrations, ERP, Order Management Systems, Payment gateways, Stock management tools, Salesforce commerce cloud, Salesforce marketing cloud, Business Manager
Retail knowledge preferable
KNOW HOW WE WORK
We act with authenticity, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Encouraging working environments where everyone can use their creativity to drive the business forward in an ever changing retail environment. Our teams are passionate about creating an authentic and unique experience for all our customers. Brown Thomas and Arnotts prides itself on working as one business and two brands. We share our knowledge and support others to be successful in achieving individual and company goals. We deliver results and celebrate success!

KNOW WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Our City Centre based stores are close to all forms of transport and surrounded by many shops, parks and beautiful restaurants.
Team discount is offered to all team members across Brown Thomas Arnotts and our Concession partners.
Wellbeing initiatives at BTA include but are not limited to;

EAP Scheme, Tax Saver Commuter, Bike to Work, Local Discounts, Sports & Social Club.

title: Business Analyst, Transportation Execution
full description:
BA or BS in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or another technical field
5+ years in delivering and influencing business processes using data analysis
Experience with IT-based root cause analysis and process design.
Strong project management skills, highly organized to ensure a timely implementation.
Experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, and demand modeling
Experience in Statistical Software such as R, SAS, SPSS, MINITAB
Able to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting ( SQL, MySQL)
Experience using one or more of Python, VBA, MATLAB, Java, C++ programming languages
Excellent communication skills and ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences.
Fluency in English. Further additional EU languages also beneficial
Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and strong analytical thinking skills are critical to success in this position

At Amazon we believe that every day is still day one. A day to take the first step and a day to look forward to new challenges. And, today is that day for you. It's your day to be part of something great. A day to make your ideas come to life and your day to join a company that redefines itself every day. A day to make history. That's the energy and passion behind Amazon.

The Transportation Execution Business Analyst works across the EU in a cross-functional environment with operations and analytics teams to support the teams to monitor, report, and predict impacts to our transportation network.

The successful candidate will have strong data mining and modeling skills and is comfortable facilitating ideas and working from concept through to execution. This role will also build tools and support structures needed to analyze data, dive deep into data and present findings to business partners to drive improvements.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Defining the project roadmap and coordinating the implementation based on the analytical results.
Understanding of analytical simulations and assessments. Must be able to quickly understand the business impact of the trends and make decisions that make sense based on available data
Reporting and analysis through tools, portals and reports; following solution-driven approach to systems and processes, using advanced computer literacy (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word) and manipulating/mining data from database tables (Redshift, Oracle, Data Warehouse)
Pull and report data from numerous databases (using Excel, Access, SQL and / or other data management systems) and to perform ad hoc reporting and analysis as required
Communicate with external customers (Carriers, Vendors / Suppliers) and internal customers (Finance, Fulfillment Centers, Supply Chain)
Implement new processes and methodologies across the organization
Master’s degree or equivalent in Logistics / Supply Chain / Mathematics / Science / Engineering / Business Development
Experience developing and growing a business / start-up / association
Proficiency with TABLEAU, Microsoft Excel to include making charts, data manipulation, pivot tables, creating macros, and visual basic knowledge.
Fluency in German, French, Polish, or other European languages

title: Financial Research Analyst
full description:
Role Title: Financial Research Analyst

Role Designation: Senior Process Executive

Reporting Manager: Team Lead

Job Level: 2A

Location: Dublin


About Infosys BPM Ltd: Infosys BPM, the business process management subsidiary of Infosys, provides end-to-end transformative services for its clients across the globe. The company’s integrated IT and BPM solutions approach enables it to unlock business value across industries and service lines, and address business challenges for its clients. Utilizing innovative business excellence frameworks, ongoing productivity improvements, process reengineering, automation, and cutting-edge technology platforms, Infosys BPM enables its clients to achieve their cost reduction objectives, improve process efficiencies, enhance effectiveness, and deliver superior customer experience. We have 35 delivery centers in 14 countries spread across 6 continents, with 42,000+ employees from over 80+ nationalities.

Role Context: The Financial Research team are responsible for helping our clients to provide interactive data and research on a variety of global industries as well as insights into individual company fundamentals.

Key Responsibilities & Deliverables:
Monitor and interpret major company developments and identify macro themes and trends affecting the market
Communicate directly with our client’s analysts to produce research materials.
Manage significant data analysis responsibilities as part of your day-to-day activities
Work with Fundamentals & Economic Statistics to ensure data completeness and quality control for existing and new data sets of target companies
Help to develop and enhance content and functionality within our client’s terminal
Review submitted research for adherence to global quality standards
Participate in department-wide special projects

Essential Criteria:
A Master's degree, preferably with a concentration in Finance
Excellent written communication and presentation skill
An understanding of advanced concepts, practices and procedures of finance/accounting
Desirable Criteria:
Solid experience interpreting financial statements and performing quantitative financial analysis
Strong organization skills and capable of handling multiple projects
Demonstrable research and analytical skills
An ability to meet deadlines, logically tackle problems and set priorities

title: People Analyst, Reporting and Insights
full description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: London, UK; Dublin, Ireland
Minimum qualifications:

Experience managing learning design projects from analysis through launch and evaluation, across a multitude of modalities (online, mobile, virtual, in-person) in global organizations.
Experience advising executive stakeholders.
Experience in adult learning, change management, instructional design, and/or leadership development.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience designing for rollout of new processes or HR transformation, such as performance management, career development, or related topics.
Comfortability with ambiguity and frequent changes in client needs and contexts.
About the job
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.

As a People Analyst, you'll work within the People Analytics Reporting & Insight (R&I) team where our mission is to empower business leaders and Business HR with data and insights to understand their organizations and drive people strategy. As a key point of contact (POC) you'll be an internal analytical consultant aligned to our geographically aligned HR partners (Market HR).
Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.
Responsibilities
Combine information from different sources to create analytical plans that address client/stakeholder needs, and execute them. Act as a thought partner to design and measure the impact of surveys, experiments and interventions.
Manipulate and analyze large datasets to distill insights from data, and convey findings to executive audiences. Create effective, scalable, and easy to understand reporting solutions (e.g. dashboards).
Build relationships and collaborate with teammates, business leaders, and HR clients to solve organizational problems.
Prioritize work to manage multiple workstreams, challenging situations, and new information.
Work through ambiguity (e.g., create structure from nothing, develop deadlines), and connect disparate ideas into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations, using creative, structured and analytical thinking.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
full description:
Digital Marketing Analyst
We are looking for a Digital Marketing Analyst to work within our Marketing Operations team. The successful candidate will be responsible for defining and implementing measurement strategies that align with marketing and business objectives; producing meaningful marketing KPI dashboards and delivering monthly, cross channel performance reports with actionable insight.
The role will also involve coordinating ongoing conversion optimisation projects, with the aim of improving efficiency in the teams digital marketing strategies and increasing ROI.
The successful candidate will not necessarily come from a pure web analytics background but an in-depth knowledge of digital marketing, along with experience in strategic and analytical management of digital campaigns is essential.
Main responsibilities
Campaign strategy:
Identifying campaign objectives and advising on suitable measurement strategies
Benchmarking performance across all online channels and advising on KPIs
Using methodical performance analysis to influence/support campaign strategies
Reporting and Analysis:
Developing custom marketing dashboard concepts
Reporting on key metrics, analysing and interpreting trends and providing actionable insights based on available analytics data
Analysing the effect of different online and offline channels on each other and developing and implementing innovative strategies for improvement and growth
Analysing online user behaviour, conversion data and customer journeys, funnel analysis and multi-channel attribution
Performing ROI analysis to evaluate efficiency and effectiveness of different marketing campaigns
Managing ad-hoc analytics and conversion optimisation projects and influencing conversion optimisation strategies with solid analytical data
Analytical and Technical:
Ensure consistency in campaign tagging
Manage the implementation of any additional on-site tracking required
Spotting potential to implement innovative new methodologies and improve analytical procedure
Using available data sources to deep dive and troubleshoot campaign (and overall) performance issues and propose methodical optimisation tests, both on-site and campaign based
Communication:
Working closely with other teams to identify and explore new business opportunities based on data insights
Collaborating with the design and development teams for on and off-site conversion optimisation projects
Collaborating with all internal teams to enhance reporting and performance measurement and conduct detailed analysis work when required
Key skills and Experience:
Experience in working within a marketing/business intelligence environment
High level of experience working with analytical software (e.g. Google Analytics, HubSpot Reports, Tableau, SQL, etc)
High level of experience in data analysis techniques and advanced Excel
High level of experience working with Google Adwords and other paid search platforms
Experience in identifying and validating strategic and tactical marketing objectives
High level of experience in measuring and analysing online marketing campaigns including: natural and paid search, email, affiliate, display and social
Experience in working with website optimisation tools for A/B and multivariate testing, e.g. Google Optimize, Optimizely, etc
Key behaviours:
Enthusiastic and self-motivated, with the ability to lead projects proactively
Meticulous attention to detail, with an overall passion for continual improvement
Innovative and creative, with a logical and methodical approach to problem solving
Credible and articulate, with excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Ability to relay analytical insight to internal and external stakeholders with various levels of analytical and digital knowledge and at all levels of seniority

title: Customer Experience - Business Analyst EMEA
full description:
Customer Experience - Business Analyst EMEA
One of the worlds largest tech brands who is committed to enhancing its customer journey and experience would like to appoint a Data Analyst / Business Analyst to support its CX team in EMEA.

What will you do
As a CX Analyst you will be tasked with reviewing metrics, data and survey responses from customers and will transfer this information to a business format to tell a story and give a clear picture of what the data means to the business. You will be required to review audience data and develop a hypothesis.
As a CX Analyst you will ask the right questions to stakeholders in order to get a clear picture. You will understand how to map this data to the voice of the customer.
Your Profile
4 years' experience within a Business Analyst, CX Analyst, Sales Analyst role
Comfortable and experienced working with large sets of data
Ability to review business data, provide insights and tell a story to the business
Experience using tools such as Excel, SQL or Tableau would be beneficial
The Offer
This role offers a salary of circa €65-68K
The role will commence as an 11-month contract
Its work from home right now - you will be provided with a laptop & mobile
Interested in finding out more? Apply today with your CV or LinkedIn profile

title: Sr. Risk Analyst
full description:
The Position:

The Senior Risk Analyst, Global Mortgage Group role encompasses Capital and Risk Management, Portfolio Management and Financial Reporting along with other analytical support responsibilities across Arch Capital Group Ltd.’s (ACGL) Global Mortgage Segment. The candidate will report to the Chief Actuary of ACGL’s Mortgage Segment.
Arch Mortgage is a growing mortgage insurance company with a strong and global parent – Arch Capital Group Ltd. If you’re interested in joining a dynamic company and working with a team of motivated, high caliber people, apply today and come grow with us!
Job Responsibilities:

Capital and Risk Management
Production of quarterly stress testing analysis, working closely with business units and other team members to ensure accuracy of incoming data and a timely production schedule.
Provide support and guidance for Own Risk and Solvency Assessment (ORSA) activities across the Segment.
Analysis of capital requirements for the Segment under Rating Agency, Regulatory and internal capital consumption frameworks.
Conduct analysis and evaluation of risk transfer solutions across the Segment.
Support the production of Solvency II Technical Provisions.
Portfolio Management and Financial Reporting
Prepare quarterly transaction level profitability, Return on Equity (“ROE”) and embedded value analyses.
Production of data and analysis to feed into quarterly financial forecasting process for the Mortgage segment.
Other Analytical Support
Prepare risk and financial reporting dashboards and presentations for quarterly business review meetings.
Maintain and enhance existing management information metrics and reports that will deliver timely and accurate information on:
Delinquency, default, repossession, claim and claim severity levels for the portfolio of in-force Mortgage Insurance exposures;
Insurance and Risk in force by geography, product type, borrower type, lender, etc.
Develop and maintain a database of direct mortgage loan performance information for the purposes of further developing and refining the Mortgage Segment’s forecasting models.
Provide analytical support to business units around the Group as required, with a particular focus on business units outside of the US, with a view to promoting consistency and best practices.
Keep abreast of mortgage lending industry developments including, regulatory, lenders, products and related economic issues.
Required Skills/Experience:

Knowledge & Skills:
In-depth understanding of credit risk from an insurance and/or banking perspective.
Strong mathematical, analytical, communication and time management skills.
Fluency with Microsoft packages, at least one programming language such as SAS, SQL, Visual Basic and database management systems such as SQL Server.
Familiarity with business intelligence platforms such as Power BI.
Abilility and desire to take ownership of own workload and work independently as required.
Ability to organize and prioritize demanding workload according to volume and urgency.
Desired Skills/Experience:

Education:

Education & Experience:
Required knowledge & skills would typically be acquired through a Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, finance or actuarial science and a minimum of 5 years of mortgage/non-life (re)insurance or banking experience.
An Actuarial or CFA designation is not a requirement, but candidates should be able to demonstrate very strong mathematical and analytical skills and experience relevant to the role.
Working Conditions/Environment & Physical Demands:
Normal office environment
Occasional travel required.
Disclaimer
Incumbent may be asked to perform other duties as required.
The Company:

Arch Capital Group Ltd. is a Bermuda-based company which provides insurance, reinsurance and mortgage insurance on a worldwide basis. Arch Capital Services Inc. provides support and expertise to entities across ACGL to help them operate effectively and efficiently. Arch is committed to helping its associates create what’s next by providing access to a variety of programs supporting your professional development and a culture that encourages innovation, collaboration and professional growth. We seek talent that thinks innovatively, values collaboration and will go the extra mile to serve our customers and develop our company.

title: Business Analyst
full description:
Job Description
Leveris Whitelabel apps are whitelabel iOS and Android native apps that are pre-integrated into the Leveris Platform. They come bundled with Leveris 3rd parties and app specific providers (analytics, logging etc.) out of the box. The apps are highly customisable, giving tremendous value to our customers.
We are looking for a talented Technical Business Analyst to join our mobile development team. The successful candidate will possess excellent technical analysis & documentation skills, will be able to navigate multiple teams and will have a strong interest in mobile front ends.
So if you’re interested in working on an awesome product set, with a fantastic and passionate team, supporting multiple clients on one codebase, then this job is for you.
Who we are
We are LEVERIS. We build banks. We build them so that financial providers can offer services quickly, differently and more beautifully than ever before. Our headquarters are in Dublin with development centres in the Czech Republic and Belarus. That’s over 150 minds working together to create banking that works better for everyone. Before we found our calling here, some of us were engineers, salespeople, analysts and even rocket scientists. While our backgrounds may vary across banking, business and tech, we’ve one key thing in common – we’ve all been customers.
Responsibilities

Create manage and maintain end-to-end process flows and API sequence diagrams for exciting banking features
Assessing and validating APIs & other integration types for suitability
Assess and compare mobile technologies and partners
Create, manage, deliver and iterate user stories
Liaise with product owners, analysts and designers for cross-team initiatives


Requirements

Knowledge of the following (or equivalent) tools: Jira, Lucid chart, Postman
3+ years experience as a Technical Business Analyst
A keen understanding of data flows and how systems hang together
Ability to take initiative and engage with senior stakeholders
Excellent communication and people skills
Strong organisational and time-management abilities
Eligible to live and work in EU


Bonus Skills

Knowledge or experience in app development
A strong interest or prior work in fintech


Benefits

Help shape one of Europe's most up-and-coming fintechs
Learn cutting-edge technology with global application
See your work in the hands of millions of people
Access to senior management
Collaborative and fun work culture
Opportunity to travel and work with colleagues and clients in other countries when it is safe to do so

title: Market Surveillance Analyst
full description:
Overview
This role will report to the Senior Market Surveillance Analyst of FRTSIL. The FRTSIL Compliance team is responsible for assisting the business manage and mitigate regulatory and compliance risk. It is an independent function within Refinitiv and reports through the Refinitiv General Counsel Team. Refinitiv Compliance supports a variety of businesses within Refinitiv globally ranging from regulated activity to activity that has regulatory touch points.
Role Summary
The Market Surveillance Analyst role will be located in Dublin, Ireland and this individual will provide first class market surveillance expertise and advice to ensure Refinitiv’s operations, as well as regulated and unregulated activities are conducted in compliance with regulatory expectations. The role predominantly interacts with our FX MTF, FXall, Matching and Dealing platforms.
Key Responsibilities / Accountabilities
· Monitor for improper trading behaviour such as price manipulation, spoofing, insider dealing, insider information violations, and general market abuse
· Review platform trading activity for any violations with Refinitiv rulebooks, operating procedures, and/or market regulations
· Manage surveillance platform alert output. Discern which alerts require further escalation. Present alert findings to Surveillance Review Team. Ensure alert risks are mitigated in a timely manner.
· Create cases associated with questionable alerts. Own alert case lifecycle from inception to completion.
· Work with the broader surveillance team to help build, create FRDs, beta test, and implement new alerts.
· Assist with alert calibration for new and existing modules.
· Engage in risk assessment and risk mitigation planning specifically related to Refinitiv trading platforms.
· Work closely with the business to develop pragmatic market surveillance solutions and opportunities while remaining cognizant of regulatory rules, obligations and expectations.
· Work seamlessly and in partnership with other members of the Refinitiv Compliance team globally, establishing and maintaining an effective colleagueship.
· Leveraging and partnering with other colleagues within Refinitiv, which include but are not limited to: IT, Onboarding, Operations, and the BU.
· Prepare management information reports for both internal and external regulatory reporting purposes.
· Assist with developing, maintaining and updating relevant regulatory policies, processes and procedures. Assist with ensuring and enforcing compliance with all aspects of these policies, processes and procedures. Assist in any other Compliance work as and when request
Technical Skills:
· Knowledge of FX products, Spot, Fwd, Swaps, NDFs, and Options or equivalent Equities or Fixed Income Knowledge.
· Knowledge of FX Trading Venues (or other product asset classes) /ECNs
· Knowledge and understanding of regulated activity, in particular MiFID and EU MAR
· Experience working with monitoring and surveillance programs or Investigative Analysis
· Proficiency in the Microsoft Suite (Excel, Word, Power Point etc.)
Interpersonal Skills:
· Excellent verbal and written communication
· Attention to detail
· Excellent planning and organization abilities
· Excellent time management and delivery skills
· Able to analyse and provide solutions
· Able to communicate and interact effectively at all levels with excellent interpersonal and team skills, together with excellent presentation skills
· Able to project manage and ensure issues are resolved or escalated effectively
· Able to work independently and as part of a team
· Process change management
Aptitude:
· Proactive
· Able to work with different cultures and nationalities
· Able to negotiate and resolve issues with meaningful solutions both internally and externally
Desired Skills:
· Knowledge of regulations/market practice in other countries – Europe, US, Asia
· Business and commercial awareness
· Knowledge of global securities laws
We care about benefits too.
We support our colleagues’ wellbeing with inclusive benefits. So that's support for physical, financial, mental and environmental health, paid time off to volunteer, consumer discounts & savings and so much more. All of which are tailored to your needs and may vary by location. For more details talk to your recruiter.
Our fast paced and supportive environment is only possible due to determined, autonomous problem solvers who love our high performance culture. And as a global business, Refinitiv relies on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. So we seek hardworking, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Refinitiv is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
Refinitiv makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us to request an accommodation. A full list of our office locations and contact information can be found at: Refinitiv Office Locations.
Be the breakthrough, activate your future and shape ours.
People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our culture of connecting, creating opportunity and delivering excellence shape how we think, how we do things and how we help our people fulfil their potential.
At LSEG we embrace diversity and actively seek to attract individuals with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We break down barriers and encourage collaboration, enabling innovation and rapid development of solutions that make a difference. Our workplace generates an enriching and rewarding experience for our people and customers alike. Our vision is to build an inclusive culture in which everyone feels driven to reach their potential.
We know that real personal growth cannot be achieved by simply climbing a career ladder – which is why we encourage and enable a wealth of avenues and interesting opportunities for everyone to broaden and deepen their skills and expertise.
LSEG are committed to supporting emotional, physical, financial and societal wellbeing. Our tailored benefits are a key part of this commitment and we offer colleagues a range of support from healthcare and retirement planning to paid volunteering days and consumer discounts.
We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please make your recruiter aware, we want to ensure you perform at your best.
As a global organisation spanning 70 countries and one rooted in a culture of growth, opportunity, diversity and innovation, LSEG is a place where everyone can grow, develop and fulfil your potential with purposeful careers.

title: IT Regional (Deskside) Support and Digital Experience Analyst
full description:
This role is a dual 50/50 role offering both Deskside support for the Dublin site and Digital Experience Analysis for our Global IT service.

This hybrid role is aimed at Deskside Support staff who have an interest in support processes, managing relationships between users and global support groups, and support service problem solving and data analysis.

The Deskside support section of this role will focus on standard IT support for Dublin based users. Working within a Global IT department to deliver best in class support to our local users, including significant Senior Leadership presence.
The Digital Experience analyst section of this role will be asked to bring predictive analysis and tools to improve our end user digital experience. They are focused on building the systems and processes we need to help us monitor and improve how our systems are experienced by our users.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Regional Services/ Deskside Support
Handling Helpdesk enquiries, interpreting requests, educating customers.
Investigate and support complex business applications and systems.
Day to day management, monitoring and troubleshooting of IT systems with the defined area of responsibility.
Deliver incidents, requests and projects to the agreed targets, SLAs and KPIs.
Deploy and troubleshoot the IT environment using extensive knowledge of Microsoft and associated operating systems and software
Work alongside team members in other countries, regions, to deliver various ongoing I.T. projects
Maintain up-to-date patching practices, records, policies and procedures as and when required
Display a focus on user satisfaction through strong interpersonal and communication skills
Digital Experience lifecycle management
Work with the User Experience team to build a Digital Experience Service which views users experience of our IT systems from issue detection to employee engagement to resolution
Investigate and build expertise in the Digital Experience tools in use.
Develop structures, reports and process which create the most value from this service.
Make best use of the tools provided and experience as a user of IT to refine the process over time.
Work with the various user groups to build relationships throughout the business.
Engage users in active conversations to understand negative experience, it’s context and where required send targeted communications
Define user profiles and groupings in order to better monitor and improve IT services
Actively work with IT groups to translate Digital Experience insights into system improvements.

Skills and Experience

1-2 years’ experience in supporting IT systems
Knowledge and experience of Windows 10
Ability to manage Desktop Devices (hardware, software and connectivity) incidents through to resolution.
Experience with the remote management of Desktop Devices using appropriate tools.
Ability to support, manage, optimize and maintain the configuration and installation of the Desktop, to include, but not limited to, patch updates, hardware replacements, with spares provided by vendor.
Ability to analyze Helpdesk calls for Desktop Devices and incident data to identify and advise users of any potential user training requirement.
Some history in, or experience of, VIP-type support for Desk side issues.
Good to have – experience of user and object management in AD.
You should be comfortable with supporting users of various levels of seniority with a mature, friendly attitude.
You should be an active problem solver, not just seeing a problem, but able to develop solutions.
Ability to quickly build relationships with users and other IT support staff and understand and predict users’ requirements.
Motivated, flexible and confident.
Experienced with some level of data analysis and communicating insights.
Ability to build and deliver presentations and reports where required.
Good oral and written communication skills

About Ardagh Group

Ardagh Group is a global leader in metal and glass packaging solutions, producing packaging for the world’s leading brands. We trace our roots all the way back to the Irish Glass Bottle Company, founded in 1932. Since then we have grown rapidly to a team of more than 16,000 people with revenues of almost $7 billion. Today we have a presence across Europe and the Americas.

Our modern Dublin office is located in the Central Business Park in Sandyford. Our Dublin team has almost one hundred employees working in finance, IT, procurement, and HR.

Did you know that Ardagh produce many of the beverage cans and bottles you drink your favourite beverages from?
Did you know we produce metal and glass packaging which are permanent materials, meaning they can be infinitely recycled without any loss of quality?
Did you know we produce more than 160 million containers per day?

Ardagh is passionate about sustainability and have a reputation for innovation. We push the boundaries of what’s possible, pioneering new production methods, new design techniques and new ways to recycle and save energy. Our aim is to reduce any negative environmental impact whilst remaining economically sustainable and socially responsible.

We believe that the success of our business depends on the success of our people. We strive to create working environments where our employees feel valued, can work to their full potential, and where their achievements are celebrated.

Here at Ardagh, we offer exciting and rewarding opportunities for talented and creative people. If you have ambition and want to make an impact with your career, come and join our team, you’ll enjoy the journey!

Click here for more information about our careers or click here for more information about Ardagh Group.

title: Business Analyst
full description:
Our client in Dublin is currently seeking an experienced and highly motivated Business Analyst.

This will be a 11 month position.
The Global Business Group (GBG) contributes directly to our client’s mission by connecting businesses with customers and helping them to maximize the return for their investment on our platforms. Within this, the Business Planning & Operations group is to maximize business performance by being an objective and trusted function within the organisation.

Our client is seeking an analytical and detail-orientated business analyst to join the Business Planning & Operations team in EMEA to support revenue reporting and insights for sales leadership as well as operational and strategic programs in the region. The main function of a business analyst is to assist in business planning and resource management activities by providing accurate, timely and thorough data analysis and insights to support business decision-making processes. Other responsibilities may include program management support of ongoing initiatives in the region. This business analyst will be expected to have excellent Tableau and excel skills and be able to work with large, complex data sets from varying data sources.

Responsibilities
Contribute to preparation of regular Rhythm of Business activities including revenue reporting and qualitative insights/analysis to provide context around KPIs and revenue metrics for senior sales and BP&O leadershipRoutinely provide ad hoc revenue analysis (revenue performance, product adoption, market trends, etc.) that will be used to support leadership business decisions and make clear recommendations based on analysis to senior BP&O leadership to drive discussions with sales on areas for investment or improvement.Support ad hoc data requests and identify opportunities for reporting, analytical or operational efficiencies across the regionContribute to forecasting initiatives to accurately forecast our business at an EMEA level, using multiple data sources to accurately predict future sales performanceWork with large data sets & complex infrastructureWork within the wider Business Planning & Operations team to support global or regional operational and strategic projects

Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Finance, Physics, Engineering), or equivalent practical experience5+ years of work experience in an analytical role, preferably in consulting, technology, investment banking or similar5+ years experience with Excel and SQL, PowerpointExcellence in TableauExperience with end to end execution of projects and program managementExperience working independently, managing multiple concurrent projects and driving initiatives in a cross-functional environmentProven analytical ability and business judgement; Proven problem-solving skillsTrack record of initiating and completing data-centric analyses leading to recommendationsKnowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, and resource allocation; strong ability to apply accounting and mathematical principles to work as neededStrong ability to work independently and manage one’s time.Clear and succinct verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail
Benefits:
Competitive salary, with great onsite benefits including canteen with all meals, drinks and snacks included.
Healthcare contribution and inclusion in company pension scheme
Work laptop and phone
State of the art modern offices
25 days annual leave (pro-rata) plus paid bank holidays
Expanding workforce with potential for career progression for top performers
Working with a company that will make your CV stand out.

title: Senior Risk & Governance Analyst
full description:
Role: Senior Risk & Governance Analyst
Reporting to: Director of Privacy & Risk
Role Description
The Senior Risk & Governance Analyst will be responsible for performing risk evaluation and ongoing monitoring of Fenergo’s Risk Management requirements, against contractual commitments. Working with a wide-range of stakeholders, the role-holder will identify, manage, and mitigate operational, technology, and enterprise-level risks.
This role requires experience in Risk Management and Governance Reporting, along with an understanding of the risks inherent in SaaS/Cloud environments and outsourcing requirements.
Main Responsibilities:
Perform Risk reviews of Fenergo internal processes and create client-facing reports.
Create and maintain an internal control framework.
Track and disseminate global regulatory guidance relating to outsourcing, cloud computing and best practices in enterprise risk management.
Maintain the internal risk register and prepare monthly reporting packs for senior stakeholders.
Promote awareness of Risk Management across the business.
Develop a Risk Culture across the business.
Additional duties/tasks as assigned.
Requirements
Experience, Skills & Education
5+ years within a dedicated risk management role within a regulated institution.
Able to demonstrate prior experience creating control statements, and ongoing monitoring of mitigating controls.
Experience in creating annual risk plans and reporting against progress.
Ability to identify solutions that satisfy relevant risk requirements while executing sound business judgement.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with proven ability to explain complex concepts in a crisp, clear, concise, and graphic rich style.
University degree required.
Recognised compliance or risk qualification advantageous
Other Desirable skills
Self-starter who drives to succeed.
Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving attributes and be solution focused.
The successful candidate must be confident at interacting with stakeholders at all levels.
Stakeholder management, influencing and facilitation.
Organised, with excellent attention to detail.
Benefits
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programmes, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University’
Opportunity to work on a cutting edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress
Active sports and social club
State of the art new offices in the heart of Dublin’s Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area
Competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, private healthcare, pension, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more

title: CS Applications & Business Intelligence Manager
full description:
Ryanair, Europe’s largest low fares airline, has an excellent opportunity for an insight driven CS Applications & Data Manager to join the growing Service Design & CS Digital Team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with one of Europe’s biggest and best digital platforms in a fast paced and challenging environment. From the cockpit and cabin to our state-of-the-art head office in Dublin, we want bright, talented and enthusiastic people who are passionate, love a challenge and who like to get stuck in.
This is a permanent position based in our Swords HQ.
Reporting to the Head of Service Design & CS Digital, you will:
Provide customer data and insight to the business to improve Customer Experience and support CS Operations
Work in partnership with Business and IT teams to capture, analyse and document functional business requirements
Work closely with our Business Intelligence and Application Support teams to automate reports and manual processes
Drive analysis to identify systems, processes and people impacts arising from new business services and procedures
Represent Customer Service interests during the design and development of new IT and digital solutions
Manage application support activities liaising with internal IT teams and external vendors
Lead digital projects to implement new technical solution and improve existing systems
Ensure that any technical solution and deliverable are fit for purpose and meet business requirements

title: Content Developer - Data & Analytics
full description:
The Guidewire Education Services team provides product training to our employees, customers, partners, and third parties around the globe. Our highest priority is enabling learners to be successful with our products and building competency that supports their journey ahead.

The ideal candidate will bring a diverse blend of experience in content development, relational databases, SQL, LMS knowledge, and knowledge of data mapping and modeling. This role requires someone who learns quickly, hates being bored, is passionate about training, and loves the satisfaction that comes from a job well done.

To be successful in this role, you must be a self-starter who loves working with a geographically dispersed team to deliver solutions that will improve the overall experience and success of our learners. You thrive when juggling multiple priorities and have a proven ability to anticipate challenges, recommend options, and drive outcomes that help ensure we can respond to the expanding needs for Guidewire Education.
Responsibilities:
Gather and analyze learning requirements.
Design, develop, evaluate, and maintain courseware and class development environments.
Contribute to improve team processes and standards.
Learn the business roles and technical functionality of Guidewire applications.
Willingness to teach your materials to up to 20 learners, particularly early versions of the course that may not be fully complete.
Job Functions:
Prepare tools, presentations, examples, evaluations, exams, labs, and simulations to teach product features and functionality that enable technical competency.
Build and maintain good working relationships with engineers, product managers, technical writers, consultants, and instructors to enable the highest quality content.
Work within the content development framework parameters and processes defined.
Qualifications:
1-3 years of designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining technical training for enterprise software organizations.
1-3 years of data warehousing and business intelligence experience.
Coding experience using modern software IDEs and including basic debugging tools.
Mastery of tools, principles, and best practices for developing technical training course materials.
Experience developing engaging graphic based content that goes beyond simple bullet point lists.
Proven track record of using content development tools including Articulate 360, Camtasia, Ancile uPerform or similar e-learning development tools.
Experience developing for a blend of modalities including instructor-led, self-paced e-learning, and/or distance learning.
Experience building effective exam questions using certification best practices.
High technical aptitude – ability to quickly grasp technical concepts and to distill technical information quickly and effectively.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong attention to detail
Experience owning course development project activities from beginning to end.
Willingness to give and get constructive feedback.
A high level of curiosity and interest in technical learning
