title: Actuarial Analyst P&C (m/f/d) - Allianz Re Dublin
full description:
We are looking for a P&C Actuarial Analyst to join our Corporate Actuarial team at Allianz Re, the Allianz Group’s global “in-house” reinsurance company based in Dublin, Ireland.
Reporting to the Head of Actuarial Function, you would be part of a small, friendly and professional team fully integrated with all aspects of the quarterly and annual reporting processes for both IFRS and Solvency II; there would also be the opportunity to be involved in reserve risk modelling and other analyses and projects.
We use modern reserving and analysis tools such as ResQ and Unify, plus statistical software such as SAS and R, and provide study support for those who wish to progress in the actuarial professional examinations.
P&C reserving on IFRS and Solvency II bases for a global reinsurance company
Contributing to projects such as the future P&C reporting under the IFRS17 standard
Reserve risk, portfolio and claims analyses
Interaction with Allianz Group Centres
Support communication with internal stakeholders (e.g. senior management, Reserve Committee, etc.)
Support communication with other internal and external stakeholders (e.g. auditors, local regulator, etc.)
Support design and implementation of controls and process improvements
Occasional business trips may be required
What we offer
A competitive remuneration and study package
A business environment that provides the opportunity to contribute and to grow, including study support towards a recognised actuarial qualification
Flexible working arrangements
A superior working environment within Allianz Ireland’s complex in Dublin 4
Opportunities to grow within the Allianz Group’s global business
Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

 Allianz Re is the Group’s reinsurance vehicle which actively manages risk and capital. Our range of activities include reinsurance, capital management, run-off, cat risk management, risk data analytics and new business developments such as MidCorp. This strong combination of skills, experience, innovative mindset and capacity drives our mission of understanding risk and creating value.

 Please submit your complete application documents (incl. CV, certificates, references and motivation letter).

We are looking forward to receiving your application via the “Apply”- button.

Allianz SE Reinsurance is committed to employment equity and therefore welcomes all applications regardless of gender, race or ethnicity, age, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or philosophy of life.

title: GNI206 - Business Partnering Analyst
full description:
Role: Business Partnering Analyst
Area: Finance
Sub-Area: GNI Business Partnering
Location: Dublin/Cork
Duration: Permanent Salary: Competitive

Ref: GNI206

Ervia is a commercial semi-state company which provides strategic national gas and water infrastructure

and services in Ireland through our regulated businesses, Gas Networks Ireland and Irish Water. Ervia

directly employs over 1,600 people who deliver services to 1.6 million customers daily. Our infrastructure

supports economic and social development, protects the environment and enhances the health and quality

of life of the Irish people. We are guardians of the national assets and experts in our field. Our infrastructure

supports economic and social development, protects the environment and enhances the health and quality

of life of the Irish people

The Role:
The Business Partnering analyst is a key member of the GNI Finance Business Partnering Team supporting

the management of the operational performance of Finance between the Business Unit and Business

Services.

Reporting directly into the Asset Management & Operations Business Partner, this role will be located close

to many areas in the Business to support the provision of high quality advice, information, analysis and

interpretation to the Business to underpin effective decision making, meaningful performance management

particularly for capital and opex activities.
Duties and Responsibilities:
 
Liaise with the extended Finance team to obtain high quality financial information, analysis and
interpretation of financials in a timely manner.
 Support the GNI Business Partnering team and Business Services teams to develop and

implement company-wide and BU specific Finance programmes, projects and processes.
 Support the GNI Business Support Business Partner in the recording and management of

operational performance, where necessary.
 Support the GNI Business Partnering team in the coordination and delivery of both the annual

budget and quarterly forecast processes, monitoring performance of results against the same
 Work with Business Services to ensure ad-hoc commercial data requested by the Business Units
i s delivered in a timely manner.
 Support the Business Partnering team and Business Services with audits associated with
commercial contracts and detailed billing queries.
 Develop and maintain working relationships with Business Unit Managers and the Finance Team by
providing value add financial insights and advice.
 Review capital and operating spend with project managers.
 Assist in approving PR’s to ensure costs are captured in the correct projects and licensed
businesses.
 Assist in ensuring the integrity of the information provided to the pre investment approval committee
(Pre-IAC) and ensuring that all Capital Budgets on the relevant systems are approved.
 Assist in ensuring that financial concerns or issues in relation to opex/capital projects and opex
costs are well understood and addressed by the Business.
 Assist in reviewing all RAB reconciliations prepared by Business Services and ensuring the correct
treatment of commissioned and decommissioned assets.
 Work with the Business and the Business Services team to ensure that costs are capitalised in line
with IFRS, work with Business Services to ensure all assets are commissioned in the correct
licensed entity and in a timely manner.
 Assist in the initiation, implementation, delivery and embedding of change and project initiatives in

the Business Unit.
 Assist in the delivery of Price Control requirements, ensuring financial information presented to the

regulators is detailed and accurately represents business performance
 Perform other duties as required from time to time, such as ad hoc project work to support the

business.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
 

Relevant third level degree and at least 3-5 years relevant experience.
 A recognised accounting qualification (ACA; ACMA; ACCA) or equivalent.
 Excellent excel and power point skills.
 Knowledge of Hyperion and oracle reporting would be an advantage.
 Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 Commercial focus while keeping overall financial perspective.
 Capable of working on own initiative and also as part of a team.
 Enthusiastic committed self-starter.
 Excellent analytical skills and be able to identify and analyse problems and potential

improvements and propose and implement solutions.
 Proven ability to operate across multiple functional areas and in a constantly changing

environment.
 Proven ability to create and develop good working relationships to facilitate the accomplishment
of work goals, coupled with the ability to gain commitment from others.
 Experience with identifying improvement opportunities, generating ideas and implementing
solutions

title: Operational Risk Analyst
full description:
The Role:
As Operational Risk analyst you will be responsible for supporting the on-going management, maintenance and embedding of the Operational Risk Management framework.
The operational risk analyst will be responsible for identifying and investigating operational risk events, ensuring root cause analysis and control assessments are undertaken. This will involve understanding deep dive reviews on significant and complex events, to provide recommendations to enhance the control environment.
The operational risk analyst will identify process/control weaknesses, raise issues, and take associated actions where required. Assist and maintain the annual risk & control self-assessments across the business. Maintain the Operational Risk register and support the development of scenario analysis.
As Operational Risk Analyst, you will also get involved in Operational Resilience tasks, such as - working on developing and implementing local business continuity plans and assist with the development of the business impact analysis program.
Risk rate critical and significant third parties; oversee the business due diligence process.

Experience Required:
Ideally looking for candidates with operational risk management experience; experience working with in a financial services environment, ideally within an Asset Management environment.
In addition to being committed to building a career within Operational risk – candidates must have excellent communication skills.
Be able to articulate complex issues to various audiences and build relationships with colleagues at all levels and across offices. They must be able to have excellent writing skills and a fine eye for detail and data management.

My client offers:
My client manages a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity, real estate and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally. This role offers the opportunity to expand your product knowledge.
Visibility: as a part of small team in the Dublin office you will have access to all areas of the business and be part of a fully integrated global team.
Autonomy: you will need to be able to manage and lead on your own projects and tasks.
Scope of Responsibility: opportunity to get involved in a variety of tasks with the Dublin office, UK Office, and US Office.

Next Steps:
If you would like to explore this role in more detail - please submit your CV to nm@barclaysimpson.com
Please note* Candidates must have asset management operational risk experience in order to be considered. They must be eligible to work in the EU. Sponsorship will not be provided.

title: Senior Business Analyst with Data Governance Experience
full description:
We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst with strong Data Governance experience and the ability to work as a product owner of enterprise data cataloging solutions such as Collibra and Alation, delivering various catalog services which enable data stewards as well as business stakeholders and technology partners to search, find, steward, trust and understand enterprise data and analytics.

S/he will be responsible for the daily operations of the catalog including conceptual design of operations, configuration, data source connections, lineage mapping, operational monitoring, user access, bulk loads of metadata, as well as the management and evolution catalog capabilities and application upgrades.

The candidate will work closely with business subject matter experts and technology teams to integrate the data catalog into the delivery life cycle for data solutions and will champion the platform as the official repository for technical metadata and lineage across the enterprise.

S/he will be required to support data quality initiatives as needed by collaborating with data stewards and business subject matter experts to define and measure the quality of company data.

Success in the role will be measured by the degree to which data knowledge and technical capabilities support Data Strategy, Governance and Enablement for client-based initiatives, ultimately providing solutions to a wide range of internal stakeholders.

Key responsibilities

Understand business requirements for data and translate them into actionable specifications and measurements for data quality analysis, reporting, assurance, and cleansing, to develop, enable and advance data catalog, governance, and stewardship capabilities

Rapidly prototype, build and deploy production level profiles and scorecards to measure, monitor, publish, and/or enhance the quality of critical datasets via streaming and batch processes

Build POCs for solutions to current issues or future opportunities

Design and own the concept of operations through the development of business processes and standards for the data catalog. Test and perform application upgrades

Be the Subject Matter Expert on Data Governance tools, providing training and technical guidance to a network of emerging data stewards, data consumers, data practitioners, and technology partners with a concentration on data catalog, to drive adoption and usage of the tools. Develop and publish catalog content and usage metrics for use in metrics dashboards.

Provide daily operational support of the Enterprise Data Catalog, including application configuration, maintaining connections and integrations to data platforms across the ecosystem, maintaining data, capability enhancements, and security role management. Resolve internal help desk tickets related to the data catalog and escalate platform defects to the software provider, Collibra.

Requirements

Demonstrated expertise in the Collibra platforms, especially the Enterprise Data Catalog and Data Quality solutions

Expert level experience with a broad set of data management and analytics techniques, processes, standards, best practices and technologies (including relational databases, data lakes, NoSQL databases, BI platforms, data movement, and data streaming) to manage and enhance Data Quality

Demonstrated experience translating functional business data rules and requirements into technical rules, rule specifications, mapping, and mapplets.

Strong ability and persistence to analyze business and technology requirements, hypothesize cause and effect relationships, model current and future state business processes, and solve complex, nuanced problems ranging from single applications to enterprise-wide

Desirable

Experience executing projects using Agile methodologies (especially SAFe)

Basic understanding of insurance business and products desirable

Ability to engender enthusiasm for everything data, to motivate and influence adoption of new ideas and capabilities, and to communicate with excellent clarity, both in written and verbal forms

title: Market Risk Analyst (Treasury)
full description:
About the organisation
This global financial services giant is a household name and employs over 20,000 people worldwide. It provides a range of products and services for its customers around the globe and has built a reputation for providing a flexible, dynamic and innovative culture. Due to an internal promotion a rare opportunity has arisen to join their group treasury function as an Analyst in their Dublin office.

About the opportunity
This is a varied and highly analytical role, which will see you involved in a range of responsibilities, primarily:
• Production of accurate and timely delivery of all daily cash management, P&L Attribution, and risk limit monitoring & reporting (including Credit Risk and Liquidity Risk).
• Validate MTM results through in-house analytics, counterparty reconciliations and use of independent alternative derivative valuation solutions.
• Monitoring daily market rate feeds into Group treasury system.
• Support derivative model validation activities.
• Production of VaR calculations for the Group derivative portfolio, and measure/quantify impact of risk exposure for proposed trades by Group Investment Management.
• Perform scenario analysis on the Groups Derivative Portfolio.
• Support other teams in investigating and explaining MTM movements.
• Support in the delivery of regulatory reporting for Treasury and derivative products.
• Provide support to Middle Office management across all group projects (including project management, project planning and project implementation).
• Set-up and reconciliation of static data in the Treasury System

About you
To be successful in this role you will have a Degree in a relevant field (mathematics, economics, business etc) plus a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role, where you will have gained knowledge of derivative valuation systems for pricing and modelling.
Equally you will have developed strong quantitative and analytical skills, with derivative pricing knowledge. Alongside this you will have excellent data analytical skills with knowledge of VBA and SQL. In person you will be a highly analytical thinker, organised and good time player.

What’s on offer
This is a fantastic chance to work for a top tier employer, who offer fantastic working conditions including flexible working, great salary and benefits package and a role you will find challenging and stimulating. This role also offers a great chance to progress your career into a front office position and postings around the world in any one of their many overseas locations.
Interested?
To submit your application for this role click Apply below or for more information on please contact James O’Donnell on 01 592 7883 or email [email protected]

full description:

ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®

We're looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.

Deliver state of the art Monitoring, Analytics and Business Insights by employing new tools, Big Data systems, AI and Machine Learning methodologies that improve efficiencies across a variety of functions in the company: Cloud Operations, Customer Support, Product Usage Analytics, Product Upsell Opportunities enabling to have a significant impact both on the topline and bottomline growth The Big Data team is responsible for:

Capacity planning
Performance tuning for various Hadoop components
Responsible for enforcing data governance policies
Help with various Big Data and cloud automation projects
Code deployment and maintenance of Big Data systems

Qualifications
To be successful in this role you have:
Expert level experience in a Hadoop administration (preferably Cloudera CDP) role.
Expert level experience working on Azure or AWS
Experience with performing Hadoop and Azure/AWS performance tuning
Experience with Ansible, Terraform, Puppet and similar technologies

title: Settlements Risk Analyst
full description:
You join a team responsible for Global Settlements for the SIG European companies. You will be working closely with traders in a front office environment, building an excellent knowledge of the products traded by SIG and also the international markets in which we operate.
This is a superb opportunity for an individual with a keen interest in the financial markets to gain exposure within a true trading environment and further their knowledge.
What you'll be part of:
Position management through analysis of long/short positions on multi listed securities and instructing reregistration of securities to cover any short positions.
Ensuring prompt and efficient settlement of all OTC and Exchange Trades across a range of different products such as: Equities, Fixed Income Bonds, Convertible Bonds, Options, ETF’s, and ADR’s, with a focus on regulatory and economic impact
Liaison with inter-company departments such as: Securities Lending, Corporate Actions, Technology, Trading Desks and Trade Support to ensure high settlement rate and best service to the traders.
Directing the Prime Broker and Direct Market Access (DMA) provider’s settlement functions
Daily monitoring and analysis of all buy-in notices received from Exchanges and DMA providers.
Proactively communicate with traders and other relevant parties to quickly and efficiently manage critical trades which may result in buy in or exchange fines
Investigation/analysis of all interest claims, fines, buy ins received in order to recommend changes to trading strategies so as to reduce such costs.
Develop good relationships with Prime Brokers, Execution Brokers and clients.
Compilation and analysis of monthly management reports on trading volume, tender offers, interest claims, buy-in notices, trade fails and PnL impact.
Research and analysis into new markets/products.
Project work directly relating to trading desks activities.

What we're looking for

3rd level degree, preferably in a business or finance related discipline is desirable.
Experience in a similar role with European Settlements experience an advantage
Attention to detail and good organizational skills are essential.
Ambitious and self-motivated, not afraid to ask questions and use own initiative
Knowledge of and an interest in financial markets and European Settlements
Previous exposure to European Exchanges desirable, but not essential
High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel and Access.
Strong communicator (verbal and written).
Strong customer focus.
Effective problem solving and analytical skills; including effective troubleshooting in a fast paced, time critical environment
Ability to work under pressure and multi-task.
 We don’t post salary ranges externally so any salary estimate you see listed here was not provided by SIG and may not be accurate.

SIG is not accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at SIG via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of SIG, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by SIG.

title: Transaction Services Analyst
full description:
The Securities & Derivatives Rep 5 is an entry level position responsible for processing orders and transactions originating from trading desks and branch offices in coordination with the Operations - Transaction Services team. The overall objective of this role is to assist in the clearance, settlement and investigation of client securities and derivatives transactions.

Responsibilities:
Identify and implement process improves of the securities and derivatives settlement process using data analysis tools and methodologies
Complete operational tasks focused on administering defined procedures, analyses and report preparation
Analyze data and make recommendations for the launch of new products and services or upgraded platforms
Minimize risk to the bank by monitoring errors and suggesting solutions that reduce errors, and ensure adherence to audit and control policies
Identify policy gaps and propose efforts to streamline the securities and derivatives settlement processes
Monitor, analyze and evaluate processes and data to ensure the accuracy and quality of completed settlement tasks
Maintain an in-depth understanding of how the team collaborates with other areas in accomplishing assigned tasks
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
2-4 years of relevant experience
Fundamental knowledge of securities/derivatives activities, policies, procedures, and concepts
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Education:
High School diploma or equivalent
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

title: BUSINESS ANALYTICS & INSIGHTS ANALYST - FLEXIBLE
full description:
Position Overview:
The role will have a passion for data & analytics, can learn quickly, being curious self-starter, flexible problem solver, and embrace an agile mentality. A team-player attitude is crucial, value collaboration, curiosity, purpose, and diversity are part of our culture.
The role will be part of a cross-functional team on initiatives that align to global/center and help guide our partners on how to interpret and understand data-driven results. This position analytical skills, with ability to develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders. A team-player attitude is crucial, value collaboration, curiosity, purpose, and diversity are part of our culture.
The role will engage a broader cross-functional team developing your own analyses, impactful insights, thoughtfully communicating those insights to enable data-driven decisions and empower and drive adoption of self-service analytics building system wide capability.
Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities:
The role will be a part of the Platform Service Data and Analytics (DnA) OU team in the EMEA Region supporting the Europe OU
The role will act as a critical thought partner to the OU organization.
Develop and identify opportunities for new types of analysis and collaborating to build the capabilities to support it.
Become a super-user of datasets, dashboards, and models to be created
Serve as the subject matter expert on analytics across several workstreams, providing a perspective on what data we have, what analytics can tell us about it, and how we can use it to optimize data driven decisions.
You understand the WHY’s behind the data to enable fact-based decision making and have the ability drive deployment, adoption, and application of analytics.
The role will layer on analyses of your own to accelerate insights creation and delivery to the OU team. You will focus on practical solutions that both empower short-term decisions and inform long-term strategy to identify and drive growth in the marketplace.
Education Requirements:
Analytics experience (4 years +) bachelor’s degree in business, Analytics or associated field
Related Work Experience:
Experience with data analytics insights and work processes for learning and decision support
Experience participating in enterprise data strategies in areas including data foundations, governance, advance analytical solutions.
An aptitude for communicating insights and collaborating across teams/organizations
A passion to learn/develop and bring in emerging trends/technology that drive further insight value
Functional Skills:
Data & Analytics
Business / commercial acumen
Communicating insights
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

full description:

title: Financial Analyst
full description:
What you can expect:
The FP&A finance analyst will report to the Europe CFO & Ireland FD. The role is based in Dublin. The finance analyst will provide outstanding FP&A support to both the Ireland business as well as to the Europe finance organisation. S/he will be a key partner of the country CEO and will also be a strong member of the European finance team. It’s a critical role with focus on identifying actions and partnering with the business so that implementation results in better financial performance. The candidate will perform multiple tasks including analysis of data, establishing a working partnership with business leaders, develop plans and assist with implementation of performance improvement plans, assisting with producing forecasts and budget while supporting the overall financial objectives of the firm and ensuring company policies and procedures are followed. The successful candidate should have a proactive, flexible and ‘can do’ style of working with a proven ability in partnering with business leaders and a high level of attention to detail.
What you will be rewarded with:
Our employees enjoy excellent benefits such as:
Competitive salary with annual review
Discretionary Company Bonus
Up to 12% company pension contribution
Full healthcare cover
Study Support
Flexitime or flexistart
Flexible working arrangements
Wellness Programme/Sports & Social clubs
Paid annual leave and ability to purchase additional leave days
Travel ticket/bike to work/dental are optional
Subsidised canteen
35 hour working week
We will rely on you to:
Assess business issues, and provide operational advice to support growth, productivity and profit improvement
Analyse client account data and seek opportunities to improve financial performance
Partner with the business and leadership so timely actions are implemented
Support the forecasting, budgeting and strategic planning activities for the market
Assist the FP&A team and business in the analysis, strategy and planning of local and global projects
Ensure consistent use of financial information across the business
Focus on key FP&A and business priorities
What you will need to have:
Professional Accounting Qualification such as ACA, ACCA, CIMA or finalist
Ideally at least 3 years’ experience in a business partnership role in the area of Financial Planning and Analysis
Enthusiasm and confidence to take ownership for delivering financial commitments
Ability to partner with business leaders to drive outstanding performance
Ability to prioritise multiple demands and guide stakeholders to focus on the key issues
Proven track record of turning information into recommendations
Ability to influence and challenge in a constructive way
Excellent communication skills with an ability to make complex issues simple
End to end problem solver who can proactively anticipate, identify and resolve
Willingness to work with Finance Colleagues across Europe and Globally to deliver the best outcome for the company worldwide
Self-motivated, positive and energized and willing to share ideas
Willingness to get into the details to understand the issues but retaining the ability to see the big picture
Skilled in building relationship across the business
Microsoft Excel, Power Point to a high standard; SmartView reporting user experience desirable
What makes you stand out:
Strong data analytical skills, experience in use of Smartview and Micro-strategy (data-mining), strong communication and problem-solving skills
Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 25,000 employees are based in 44 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. In Ireland, Mercer employs over 600 employees in offices based in Dublin and Cork. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 76,000 colleagues and annual revenue of $17 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit https://www.me.mercer.com/. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer.

title: Payments Analyst
full description:
The Opportunity

Commerce Operations sits within the eSW Product Group and includes Payment Operations, Fraud Operations and Operational Excellence. Serving some of the world's most recognisable retail brands in over 80 countries the operational services the team provides is critical to the success of the business and in supporting the ambitious strategic business goals.

Reporting to the Payments Product Manager, the Payments Analyst plays a key role in analysing all aspects of payment product, shopper behaviours, service providers, business processes and related data to identify business and product improvements.

The successful candidate will need to show an ability to consistently deliver in a fast-paced environment, requiring a lateral thinking individual that thrives on new challenges and scenarios and who will drive research and analyses for a broad range of opportunities in the payment/fraud industry

Key Responsibilities

Build relationships and work closely with eSW's Engineering, Product, Operations and Analytics teams, inspiring changes to data sources and business systems that are necessary to deliver on the payments strategy.
Research new technologies and payment methods to improve the product offering to eSW's retailers.
Support the Product Manager in defining detailed feature requirements, documenting use-cases, creating and delivering management reports and managing client relationships.
Help manage and select Payments Service Providers, Acquirers and related service providers.
Discover signals, test new ideas and implement new features in our product to improve payment performance.
Use Data Analytics to identify business improvement opportunities, optimise business performance, solve complex problems and prove ROI.
Adopt standardised data-led methodology to investigate the impact of proposed business changes and new product features and services.
Develop in depth knowledge of eSW's data sources, fraud and payment systems to gain insights into shopper behaviour and contribute to the payments strategy.
Establish and implement KPI and Scorecards that drive change and business improvements.
Ensure cost and performance metrics deliver insights that enable the team to make better strategic and operational decisions.
Work closely with internal and external business partners to respond to ad hoc requests and provide analysis, identify root cause of issues, provide results and recommendations in a timely manner to support payment team's objectives.

Key Requirements

5+ years experience in eCommerce operations, preferably in physical goods and retail sectors with a solid understanding of its current evolution globally.
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills and the ability to derive insight from multiple data sources
Excellent skills querying data using SQL, B.I. tools, manipulating data and building dashboards in excel (pivot tables, VBA, charts)
Attention to detail required to drive formalisation of processes in highly complex and fast-moving organisations.
Must have strong communication skills and be comfortable interacting with Sr Management and third party stakeholders
Must have the ability to articulate both technical and business requirements to Product Managers and 3rd Party Providers
Experience delivering results through vendors by effectively establishing and maintaining relationships

What's on offer?

Career growth – tailored learning & development, tuition assistance and professional certification.
Health & Wellbeing – dental & health insurance, reduced corporate gym membership, paid sick leave.
Work Life Balance – 25 days annual leave, flexible working, sports & social club.
Family – paid maternity & paternity leave, life assurance, income disability cover.
Financial – competitive salary, pension, bike to work, travel TaxSaver, relocation assistance.

About us

Founded in 2010, eShopWorld powers cross-border ecommerce for the world's best-known brands, creating safer, simpler, and faster shopping experiences for consumers all around the globe. ESW's powerful combination of technology and human ingenuity optimizes the entire shopper journey, from site development to demand generation to checkout, through shipping, customer service and returns.

With configurable end-to-end solutions in more than 200 markets worldwide, we fully manage payments, compliance, data security, fraud protection, taxes and tariffs, helping clients enter new markets in as few as 6 weeks, and dramatically improve results in current markets. Bringing together more than 400 experts across multiple disciplines, the ESW team delivers profitable growth for retailers and brands worldwide.

title: Lead Country Analyst Ireland
full description:
Brief description:
We are seeking a business-minded data analyst with hands-on analytics and coding experience. Together with your team you will build reports and present them to stakeholders of Country Managing Director Ireland to help her achieve better support in our business. As such, you use both your superb analytical and communication skills in transmitting your passion for data to the whole company.
Location:
Dublin, Ireland
Main stakeholder:
Amanda Roche Kelly (Country Managing Director Ireland)
Team:
You will be the intelligent brain of the Country Managing Director for Ireland in the Dublin office, working closely with the central Data & Analytics team. You will have support from the central Data & Analytics team, as this team provides data, analytics tool(s), and tips that are necessary for efficient and effective analysis.
Your job:
Design measurable metrics and KPIs according to the business of stakeholders, and develop reports using Business Intelligence tools and languages such as Tableau, Amazon Redshift SQL, Google Big Query, so that stakeholders can regularly keep track of their achievement and know where they are right now;
Proactively propose business action which is taken out from data to stakeholders, so that they can take an innovative approach to efficiently and effectively improve their business;
Inspire and collaborate on new strategic insights with the central team
Identify new developments in business analysis tools and techniques available in the marketplace, and recommend new directions to management
Manage subordinate members to leverage their capability and maximize output as a team, by defining the scope of work and timeline with communicating with stakeholders and controlling their expectations.
Your profile:
5+ years of working experience in a similar role, preferably related to business analysis to make strategic decisions such as defining and measuring achievement of KPIs, and to propose business action out of it
Expert knowledge and experience in SQL so that you can extract one off data from data warehouse independently, in order to build operational insights based on the day to day business for the Country MD
Ability to develop and lead a team in line with our company values
Ability to translate business requirements into technical approach in order to answer the questions coming from within the business
Ability to construct and present a logical structured story from your analysis to an audience without using technical terminology, so that business users can understand your story without any stress
Experience in E-Commerce or consulting with presenting analysis results to executive is highly rated

Expectations on the first 3 months:
Month 1 and 2, you join the central Data & Analytics team to absorb the tools used, way of working and guidelines
Month 3 you’ll drive the insights for Country Managing Director Ireland and be part of the tribe that organizes monthly meetings, reviews of products and insights all in order to grow knowledge!
Required skills and experience

title: Senior Business Ops Analyst
full description:
A leader in the payments industry, Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing solutions and services to more than one million merchants around the world. If you want to make a difference in your life, your community and your world, join us at Elavon. We know our company is only as strong as our people, and we are committed to your professional growth and success. Elavon is part of the U.S. Bank family, a diverse workplace, where we celebrate the individuality of each member of our global team.
Job Description
Overview:
As a Senior Business Operations Analyst you will assist the Trust Technology and Support Services (TT&SS) business lines with enterprise, acquisition technical readiness, service request projects and ongoing technology support. Provides coordination of small to mid-sized company efforts by performing business technical analysis, task management, project support, testing coordination and meeting coordination. Ensures end user technology requirements are met through analysis and implementation of appropriate solutions. Provides technology project analysis/support during acquisition technical readiness projects to ensure end user technology requirements are met and properly implemented. Provides technology project risk mitigation support, serves as liaison and advocate for business lines that are impacted by enterprise wide projects. Interfaces with internal and external resources to ensure successful implementation in accordance with business partner needs.
Functional Responsibilities
Research, test, and develop reporting outcomes for operations teams using MS and Oracle SQL to query SWIFT related data-sets; then MS Report Builder for design.
Gather requirements and assist with the development of macros and other transformations in MS Excel and Access utilizing VBA.
Monitor and support an application that scans SWIFT messages against OFAC lists. Provide additional context when requested and facilitate communication between screening teams and the business lines.
Act as a liaison between SWIFT Strategy teams, Technology Operations, and business units for general SWIFT related questions and support
Actively participate in key projects with SWIFT components
Test SWIFT messages (production, business line UAT, regression, clients)
Manage trust BICs and Branch codes
Handle SWIFT Alliance non-routed messages; research duplicate, failed, or unsolicited messages
Maintain SWIFT procedures ensuring compliance with established policies and practices
Evaluate the SWIFT annual release, identifying business lines and applications that may be affected by changes
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
Three to five years of experience in operations/technology project management activities
Preferred Skills/Experience
General knowledge of policies, plans, procedures, products and regulatory requirements for assigned business unit
Exposure and high level understanding of SWIFT messages and processing
Ability to conduct an analysis of a business need, including scheduling meetings, planning agendas and conferring with business line leaders
Self-starter who can work under minimal guidance with little to no requirements and provide significant daily value without having to be monitored
Able to resolve issues/inquiries received to the team with appropriate teams/custodians quickly with little or no guidance from manager
Strong data processing skills with exposure in the following: MS SQL,
PLSQL, SSRS, VBA.
Strong organizational and communication skills: They are able to make the complex seem understandable and consumable via a variety of visual illustrations, data, and mapping documents
Takes ownership of projects and assigned tasks assigned from manager and regularly meets deadlines.
Benefits :
We offer an exciting, fast-paced and diverse working environment with employees of many different nationalities. We provide benefits to help you protect your health and financial security; and give you peace of mind. We also invest in your career growth with development resources that give you the opportunity to stretch and shine.
This is an Elavon posting. Elavon is a part of the U.S. Bank family.

title: Client Experience Analyst
full description:
Our client in Dublin is currently seeking a highly experienced and motivated Client Experience Analyst.

The position will be an 11 month contract.

We are looking for an exceptional Client Experience Analyst to join our client's EMEA Business Planning and Operations (BP&O) Small Business Group team . The mission of the team is to ensure we deliver holistic and impactful customer experience, ensuring small businesses globally maximise their growth potential when engaging with our programs. You should be someone who is passionate about delivering superior customer experience, a person who thinks and acts globally but understands the importance of market nuance and a desire to serve our small businesses.

The ideal candidate will be as comfortable working with data and logic as well as having a client centric lens providing the business with focused insights on our client experience and journey. You will require a high level of empathy for small business owners, understanding of sales structure and a keen eye for identifying process and workflow improvement opportunities. Success in this position requires strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills; attention to detail; the ability to thrive in a dynamic and changing environment; and a passion for helping others achieve results. You will be able to demonstrate high levels of enthusiasm, motivation and dedication and an ability to manage communication and relations with multiple stakeholders both internal and external, including teams from Sales, Quality Assurance, Training and our outsourcing partners.

This position will be based in Dublin and will be supporting initiatives across EMEA.

Responsibilities:

Understand data and deliver holistic insights utilising operational data such as: AHT; pitch-rates and action-rates (revenue);
Understand how to map these signals to Voice of the Customer data and Quality Assurance data to identify, through root-cause analysis, the agent behavioural levers driving operational performance across multiple programs, regions markets and verticals.
Leverage and unify multiple customer listening posts (surveys, customer verbatim, focus groups, social media, etc.) to create a more reliable and sensitive customer feedback signal.
Develop and assess customer experience through direct contact interactions and trend analysis, ensuring strong reporting capability on contact centre agent performance, understanding and communicating the narrative to internal and external stakeholders through a robust set of metrics, data visualization and presentation.
Coordinate with outsourced vendor partners (as required) to share insights, identify focus areas, and agree on actions.
Create specific recommendations and action plans to drive product, people and process improvement strategy across multiple customer touchpoints and work with cross-functional partners to identify and implement optimal solutions.
Create detailed project plans and clear communication strategies to drive effective changes.
Minimum Requirements:

4+ years of relevant experience in business operations, sales excellence, process redesign, a consulting role, quality assurance or customer experience.
Experience with SQL, tableau, data analysis & visualization tools.
Strong operational background and project management skills with experience running strategic projects with cross-functional teams.
Fluency in English, both oral and written
Excellent business acumen, passion for solving problems, and strong analytical skills.
Preferred Qualifications:

Self-motivated, entrepreneurial, and dealing with ambiguity.
A love for change and an ability to ruthless prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Strong desire to collaborate, share, drive best practices cross-functionally and globally.
Innovative and creative in finding solutions/ designing improved methods, systems and processes.
Attention to detail and ability to deep dive, identify root causes of variances; further execute solutions once identified.
Benefits:
Competitive salary, with great onsite benefits including canteen with all meals, drinks and snacks included.
Healthcare contribution and inclusion in company pension scheme
Work laptop and phone
State of the art modern offices
25 days annual leave (pro-rata) plus paid bank holidays
Expanding workforce with potential for career progression for top performers
Working with a company that will make your CV stand out.

title: Systems Analyst, SaaS Operations, Charles River Development, Senior Associate
full description:
Who we are looking for
A client-facing, business and technical staff position responsible for all aspects of managing production Charles River IMS systems for multiple Clients as part of the Charles River Software as a Service (Saas) offerings which includes Application Management for hosted and non-hosted clients.
Why this role is important to us
The team you will be joining is a part of Charles River Development (or CRD), that became a part of State Street in 2018. CRD helps create enterprise investment management software solutions for large institutions in the areas of institutional investment, wealth management and hedge funds. Together we have created first open front-to-back platform - State Street Alpha, that was launched in 2019.
Join us if delivering next generation infrastructure, using emerging technologies like AI and Blockchain sounds like a challenge you are up for.
What you will be responsible for:
This role will involve working closely with Clients, providing expert level remote management, administration and support for Client production Charles River IMS solutions, including:
Client assistance in optimal use of the system
User administration/privileges
Parameter configuration changes
System availability
Application and database performance tuning
Daily operational processing monitoring and support
Charles River IMS and database software patches
Charles River IMS version upgrades
Assistance with problem support and resolution
Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery assistance
Working with Charles River colleagues to smoothly transition new Clients to production operation.
Working with vendors as partners to deliver a tightly integrated, seamless service to Charles River Clients.
Participation in the development and on-going refinement, enhancement and continuous process improvement for the services.
Participation in the investigation, implementation, and operation of 3rd party tools to enhance/improve, automate, and streamline the delivery of the services.
The role will involve periodic out of hours support and/or weekend work.
 Occasional travel to customer sites may be required for planning and review meetings.
What we value
Experience with Financial Services Investment Management, Trading or related systems preferable ( e.g. Charles River IMS)
Proven ability to partner with various internal departments to deliver superior customer service.
Experience in MS SQL Server, Oracle, and/or Sybase database configuration, operations, and basic administration functions.
Any experience with the following is preferred: servers, operating systems, networks, scripting, XML, programming languages, job scheduling software, system monitoring software and disaster recovery/business continuity.
Excellent customer service skills, technical troubleshooting skills, and interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Education & Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a technical or analytical discipline such as Computer Science, IT, Financial Engineering, Engineering, Science, Economics, Maths’ or Statistics preferred.
A couple of years’ relevant industry experience
About State Street
What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.
Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.
Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.
State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

title: Senior Data Analytics Lead
full description:
Senior Data Analytics Lead
Job Overview:
We are seeking a Senior Analytics and Data Science Lead to join our growing IT Team. This candidate will work in an agile development environment and will lead a team to build Data and Analytics solutions for energy balancing and trading markets. The solution will combine data from energy markets and IOT sensors to deliver smart energy optimisation recommendations as well as energy trading strategies. The solution will communicate, monitor and orchestrate the implementation of recommended load profiles.
Similar to financial portfolio management the solution will have a dynamic component which will make real time decisions to move energy assets between different market opportunities to maximise financial return.
The solution will be developed using Azure's Cloud services and the candidate should have hands on experience of using Azure or other cloud services for developing data analytics solutions. Ideally the candidate would have gone through the whole development life cycle from design to implementation to production on Azure/AWS during previous projects.
Main Responsibilities:
Leading a team of Data Scientists, trading analysts and other subject matter experts to deliver an end-to-end energy optimisation and trading solution
Design data solutions using latest services from Azure eco-system. Present various design choices, trade offs and lead the team through picking the right technology choices.
Exploit industry best practices and your experience to create a data platform to enable business growth.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to collect and document technical requirements, translate them into solution design and lead a cross functional team to deliver a production ready analytics solution.
Contribute ideas to help ensure that required standards and processes are in place and actively look for opportunities to enhance and innovate solutions and improve process efficiency.
Apply data visualisation tools and implement dashboard solutions that are customer focused and help drive product design decisions
Leverage expertise to develop and lead new data analytics technologies for product development, providing new growth opportunities in addition to supporting existing products and businesses
Excellent communication, presentation, and team leadership skills.
File patent applications, publish, and present@conferences. Collaborate with external research teams to build capabilities and applications to solve emerging challenges.
Required Experience and Skills:
A minimum of 5 years' professional experience is required.
Azure/AWS Experience (3+ years) applied to delivering a data driven analytics solution.
Azure/AWS Data Certification a plus
DataScienceandAnalytics experience including team leadership
Machine Learning (Neural Networks, Decision Trees, etc.)
Deep learning libraries such as Keras, Tensorflow, Theano, or Python.
SQL and relational database concepts
Distributed computing platforms such as Spark
Experience working with Data Warehouse, Data Lake and Cloud AI to deliver a customer facing analytics solution
Experience of working with Big Data stack including real time streaming using Spark/DataBricks or similar technologies to meet tight time budgets.
Python/R programming for Data Science and Data Engineering.
Experience of working with Power BI, Tableau or similar for designing internal and external dashboards and data analyses.
Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into design of end-to-end data systems
Strong scientific and technical acumen, with demonstrated interest and ability to make connections between science/technology and real-world concerns
Ability to deal with the ambiguity of early stage scouting and evaluation of new opportunities and the flexibility to change direction as additional information becomes available
Leadership qualities such as excellent communication skills (oral, written and presentation), networking skills, self-motivation, and self-direction.
Previous experience working in financial, or trading market will be plus.
Previous experience working in energy sector will be a plus.
Technologies:
Technologies: Data Science, Data Integration, Orchestration, Data Warehouse, Data Lake
Core Programming languages: Python, R, T-SQL, Power BI DAX
Desired Qualifications and Other Experience:
A minimum of 5 years with a third level degree in Maths, Physics, Engineering, Computer Sciences or a related discipline.
Commercial experience in designing mission critical data intensive analytics solutions.
Experience in handling large and complex datasets using multiple programming languages (T-SQL, Python, R etc.) is essential
Experience analysing multiple business domains and translating them to production ready data/analytics solutions
Experience of using machine learning, data visualisation, and artificial intelligence techniques.
Experience leading a cross functional team including Data Scientists, Data Engineers and SMEs to deliver and end to end analytics solution
The following experience would be advantageous but not essential:
Experience working in an energy related industry combined with a passion for energy sustainability and innovation
Experience designing a data driven solution for financial or trading industry
Benefits:
Competitive salary.
Pension.
Life cover benefit.
The candidate must have a valid visa to work in Ireland

title: Senior Software Engineer
full description:
Requisition ID: 270260
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
Our Advanced Analytics team is looking for a software engineer with experience in microservice development and delivering solutions with Cloud technologies, to join us in building the future of SAP's data intelligence strategy.
Our team works out of our next-generation AppHaus which is a unique physical space for software development, a living embodiment of the philosophy of Design Thinking.

Java and Node microservicesHANA XS JavaScript servicesCloud Foundry and Kubernetes as a platformSAP HANA/PostgresTypescript and React frontend with Jest, Jasmine and Robot Framework testing technologies

title: Senior Java Engineer (Application Development)
full description:
Introduction
Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Telco Analytics Solutions (TAS) provides real-time insights into how customers use data services, enabling Communication Service Providers (CSPs) to optimise the customer experience and drive greater profitability. We are looking for talented individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit, who have the drive and passion to succeed and want to be part of our Telco software development group. We wish to recruit an experienced Java Engineer (Application Development) to join our Application Development team.

The Application Development team is responsible for implementing both business and internal technical features for the TAS Application Suite of products. This team is responsible for developing and maintaining: a system capable of processing and analysing billions of records per day in real time; a distributed database framework – capable of providing real-time access to the mediated data; a shared common API to access and store data; and the presentation layer to provide users with an interactive and intuitive access to highly complex, multi-dimensional data. Our solution is developed using Java, Flink & Python and uses hadoop/Cassandra/Kafka as its data store and runs on RHEL and in Docker/Kubernetes containers.

The Application Development team collaborates with Product Management to define requirements and the future roadmap, and also with the support and customer delivery teams to aid in customer deployments and other support issues.

Reporting to Development Manager, the Senior Java Engineer will be responsible for:

Key Responsibilities:

Analyse Enterprise-level product requirements.Produce functional specifications and test plans in the course of implementing solutions.Design, develop, test and maintain the software solutions in Java/Flink or other languages on Linux/Docker/KubernetesInteract with operations/support to provide analysis and rapid solutions to customer issuesReport on development progress daily in Agile / SCRUM process.
#CLOUDIE21

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Reliable knowledge and experience with programming in Java and/or FlinkReliable knowledge and experience with development tools and processes (Git, JIRA, unit test, automated test, Ansible)Reliable knowledge and experience with SQLReliable knowledge and experience with Linux (RHEL ideally)Have worked in an Agile Development methodology such as Scrum/KanbanReliable knowledge of multithreading, object oriented design, algorithms and development patterns.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsReliable skills and ability to define/refine/propose requirements.Continues to demonstrate an organized, systematic, disciplined and analytical approach to designing, problem solving, coding and defect fixing.
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Experience of Kubernetes/Docker/OpenShift a distinct advantage.Experience of hadoop/hive/Kafka/Cassandra a distinct advantage.Experience of Telecoms and network data protocolsExperience of Python, Web UI & REST web service development
Minimum Requirements:

BSc in Computer Science, or with comparable real-world experienceMinimum of five years’ experience working in a development role within a software engineering companyGood spoken and written English skills.
About Business UnitIBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location StatementIBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you, this might

mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern,

please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java/Spring) EMEA Dev Centre
full description:
Senior Software Engineer (Java/Spring) EMEA Dev Centre
Working for a mid-sized US tech product multinational, in this role you will be working alongside talented product managers, software engineers, UX designers and our site reliability engineering team in a highly AGILE Environment.
You will be mentoring and coaching more junior members of your team and will be contributing at the highest level to our software’s design and architecture. You will be responsible for coding, test automation, software configuration of complex enterprise applications on the JVM as well as helping to facilitate improvements to ways of working. The software is primarily built on the JVM and exposes rich RESTful APIs that are consumed by native mobile clients. The backend technologies include: Spring-Boot and much of the Spring stack interacting with datastores like MySQL, MongoDB, Redis and Elasticsearch. They build, automate and deploy with Gradle, Gulp, Ansible, Docker. We have supporting tools written in Python, Bash and Groovy. The company have a great team for the multinationals EMEA operation based out of lovely offices in Dublin south city centre and are expected to double in size in the coming 2 years across a variety of products.
YOU?
To get an interview you will have a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related and over 5 years commercial experience as a backend engineer for a Software Product company using an Agile software lifecycle including TDD, pair programming, short release cycles with at least one automation focused scripting language and expert knowledge of Java, working on a distributed cloud-based architecture and developing RESTful API’s.
Experience with dependency injection frameworks e.g. Spring, Guice
Experience with build technologies e.g. Gradle, Maven
Java application server experience e.g. Jetty, Tomcat, Underto

Desired Skills:
Full stack web development with a modern web framework
Deployment and configuration management tools like Docker, Ansible
Automation Testing: Junit, Gatling.
Languages: Groovy, Kotlin, Clojure, Javascript, Swift/Objective-C, Python

What's on offer:
A competitive compensation package which includes healthcare, vision, dental, life insurance, disability insurance, pension contribution, fitness reimbursement and much more.
A dynamic work environment with smart colleagues.
A high degree of autonomy, flexibility and trust.
€55-70K + Pension + Benefits including Health and more. For more information contact Jack Killeen on jack.killeen@recruiters.ie and include a good way and time to reach you

title: Staff Software Engineer - Cloud Monitoring
full description:
Company Description
ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®

We're looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.

Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.
Job Description
As a Senior Software Engineer you will be a member of a team that is responsible for building and integrating software components that acquire, correlate, aggregate, analyze, store and visualize enormous amounts of data regarding the health and performance of our cloud and underlying services and infrastructure.

The ideal candidate should have a strong background in software development, systems architecture and engineering, understanding of the components of software infrastructure, including hardware platforms, OS, virtualization, application, databases, web and application servers. Prior experience in software development/engineering, release management/devops and managing large-scale server infrastructure distributed is highly desirable.
What you get to do in this role:
Build high-quality, clean, scalable and reusable code by enforcing best practices around software engineering architecture and processes (Code Reviews, Unit testing, etc.)
Work with the product owners to understand detailed requirements and own your code from design, implementation, test automation and delivery of high-quality product to our users.
Design software that is simple to use to allow customers to extend and customize the functionality to meet their specific needs
Contribute to the design and implementation of new products and features while also enhancing the existing product suite
Be a mentor for colleagues and help promote knowledge-sharing
Qualifications
To be successful in this role you have:
7+ years strong programming experience using Java/Python languages.
Strong hands-on experience with Operating System (Linux preferably) using multi-processes, IPC mechanisms, multi-threading, filesystems etc.
Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
Experience with building distributed systems with HA capabilities.
Experience with message bus such as RabbitMQ, Kafka is a big plus
Experience with scripting languages such as Javascript/Python/Ruby in a UNIX environment.
Experience with open-sourced time series databases like InfluxDB, Prometheus and visualization software like Grafana is a plus
FD21
Additional Information
ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at +1 (408) 501-8550, or [email protected] for assistance.
For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.

title: Senior Software Engineer
full description:
This is a great opportunity to join a fast-expanding Fintech that is disrupting and revolutionising the finance industry.

We are looking for smart & enthusiastic full stack and back-end developers, who can thrive in a fast-paced, fun & bleeding-edge technology environment and who are looking to challenge themselves and us to do better.

Our technology stack is micro-services based and includes Kotlin/Java, Angular, JavaScript, TypeScript and some Python and C#. Our SaaS Cloud deployments utilise Docker, Kubernetes (AKS) and Azure infrastructure and are automated using Jenkins pipelines.

We are an expanding Agile company building up cross functional teams to deliver high quality, scalable software solutions via Scrum/Kanban methodologies. Kaizen (continuous improvement) is a key part of our DNA.
Responsibilities

As a senior member of a dynamic cross functional team you will have many responsibilities including but not limited to:

Contribute to and drive the success of the team in designing, developing, testing and delivering high quality enterprise grade software solutions.
Working closely with engineers, architects and product managers across the whole business. Engaging with distributed teams and partners to ensure cohesive development across the platform and technical stacks.
Contribute to story refinement and create solution designs.
Ability to design and implement solutions to complex problems with minimal supervision.
Participate in code, test and design reviews.
Mentor other software developers on design patterns and development best practices.
Investigate, evaluate & introduce appropriate tools, technologies & techniques.


Personal Attributes

You take pride in the team’s ownership of their projects and code.
Team player with good Communication and Interpersonal Skills
You’re focused on balancing both business and technical requirements.
You value simplicity and maintainability over excessively abstracted solutions.
You have curiosity beyond your own domain of expertise
Self-disciplined/self-starter/positive attitude with drive & commitment to deadlines
Analytical with strong attention to detail.
Results Oriented


Essential Skills

As a Senior Software engineer you have 5+ years of real-world commercial experience in delivering production grade software.

Kotlin/Java application development experience using springboot
Experience working in an Agile development environment within scrum or Kanban teams
Experience in automated testing, working with a number of automated frameworks (e.g. Robot, NUnit, Jasmine, Cucumber, Selenium/Protractor, etc)
TDD and BDD experience an advantage
Working knowledge of OO Design principles and patterns such as SOLID & DRY
Good understanding of Web Services protocols such as REST and API design for extensibility and portability. Swagger or openAPI experience
Proven experience developing SaaS on Azure or AWS.
Experience debugging distributed systems with high loads including performance and memory profiling
Strong industry experience in architecture and development of scalable production quality backend systems, including HA, DR, security and resiliency aspects.
Experience with designing and implementing microservices
Experience working with business stakeholders to understand business requirements and build thoughtful solutions
Experience working with containers and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes, AKS, Docker, istio, etc.)


Useful Skills

Familiarity with Kotlin,
Experience in some of Kong, Okta, JWT, Auth0, SSO.
Strong proven experience with web technologies (Angular, CSS, SASS, HTML5, Javascript, JQuery and Typescript)
Experience of Fintech, Secure Coding, secure code reviews.
Any Blockchain/DLT experience/understanding a benefit
Experience with Python
Knowledge of workflow engines such as Cumunda
Solid working knowledge of database design, scripting and optimisation including MS SQL Server, MongoDB or other NoSQL & RDBMS.
Expertise in application integration technologies (SSO, OAuth, etc.)
Secure development and integration of DevOps tooling (Jenkins, GitHub Enterprise, Consul, Vault, Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Azure Manager Resource templates, workflows, vendor SaaS, etc.)
C# .NET application development experience (up to .NET Core 2.0)
Experience working with .NET web application development technologies (E.g. C#, Linq, Entity Framework, MVC, Dependency Injection, Message Queuing)
Experience of powershell, bash, Helm


Qualifications

5+ years real world industry experience
Minimum of Bachelor level software degree or equivalent courseware and work experience

title: Senior Software Engineers/Staff Software Engineers

Experience in Python and/or Go is a plus
